reviewText: I discovered Michelle LeMay's stretch workouts on FitTv with a program called "All Star Workouts."  I loved her segment so much that I decided to invest in her DVD series.  "Alive in Your Body" is the longest in the Spirit Flow series and is the only full body stretch that I've found on DVD from Michelle.Before I go any further in my review, if you've done Michelle's workout on FitTv, this is a very similar routine.  There are a couple of new more-difficult stretches and a few omitted ones, but overall it's her Stretch Fusion workout from "All Star Workouts" on DVD.Other reviewers have done an excellent job describing what is in the DVD, so I'll just talk about it a little more in-depth.  Like I said earlier, this is a full body stretch; however, there are a few muscles that you won't stretch out too much.  Mostly you're just going to miss your arms.  There are no stretches for the biceps, triceps, or forearm; and there are very few stretches for the shoulders.  Nearly every other muscle will get stretched thoroughly, though.Also, many of the stretches are not necessarily advanced but just very deep.  Because I'm not that flexible, it was a struggle to relax in many of the stretches.  Michelle offers no modifications for the movements, though she will occasionally say something about bending your knees or not leaning as far into the stretch if you're not that flexible.  I wish she would have still actually shown viewers a modification.  This DVD is definitely not for inflexible beginners to stretching.There are several spiritual aspects of this DVD that were a bit uncomfortable for me.  Michelle begins and ends the workout by chanting something about being grateful.  I'm not entirely sure who she's talking to or what she's grateful for, but it's a little strange.  Also, several times she'll instruct the viewers to chant with her during the workout or breathe into our heart center.  I wish she would have focused a bit more on the actual stretching and less on the spiritualism of this DVD.  It's not that big of a deal, but it is distracting from the relaxation at times.Another thing that Michelle does a lot of during this DVD is move through the stretches.  Instead of going into a stretch and staying there in a static position, she "massages the muscle with the movement" and rocks her body around while in the stretch.  With some of the stretches it feels good, while I don't like it too much with others.  If the viewer just wants to do the static stretch instead, though, it's simple to ignore her rocking instructions.It may sound like I've complained a lot about this DVD, but it's not a horrible stretch DVD.  It's somewhat relaxing as long as I skip through the stretches that require the extreme flexibility that I don't have.  It is my least favorite of her Spirit Flow series, though, and I only recommend it to extremely flexible people looking for a relaxing and spiritual non-static full body stretch.I preferMichelle LeMay's Sprit Flow: 7 Essential Stress Relieversfor relaxation andMichelle LeMay's Sprit Flow: Rejuvenating Core Stretchfor stretching.  Both are easier to use if you're on inflexible side.  I also really enjoyCrunch - Candlelight Yogaas a mixture of both relaxation and stretching.
summary: Spiritual full body stretch only for the flexible
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a really nice stretch program lasting about 60 minutes.  Michelle Lemay's dance background influences this stretch program with flowing moves. Toward the end, the moves are held for longer periods of time, but most of the DVD is made up of gentle and flowing stretches, along with some yoga poses.  Her voice is very soothing and relaxing.  She sits on a large rug/mat that appears to be floating in a blue sky. Words such as "relax" and "breath" sometimes float through in a cloud form.  The music is wonderful - very relaxing and soothing.This is a great program to use if you are feeling stiff and tight or are low on energy but know you need to move your body.  I did this when I really didn't want to do anything physical and felt so much better within five minutes. Her opening sequence is wonderful.My one complaint is that it's 60 minutes long, but you can fast forward through some of the sequences that are done for five minutes or so.The DVD reminds me of "gentle yoga" classes I've taken.  Lemay encourages you to work within your own range and that the more you stretch, the better off you'll be.I have no idea what a regular stretch DVD is like.  I bought this elsewhere, thinking it was a yoga DVD, and it is, but she doesn't use sanskrit and doesn't always names for poses, which is fine. She keeps it flowing. There's a lovely stretch she calls "double pigeon," but I'm not sure if that's the correct name.If you're seeking a gentle, encouraging stretch DVD, this fits the bill.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I just did this workout for the first time yesterday and I love it. I thought I would dread doing stretching for an hour, but it was sooo relaxing and felt great. It's not your typical stretching routine. There's lots of different moves she does that I haven't see in any other video. Michelle's voice was very soothing and encouraging. I felt nicely stretched out and relaxed when I was done. In fact, I was so relaxed, I wanted to go back to bed!I also have her other 2 workouts that are shorter and those are great too.I would definitely recommend this (and her other 2 videos) for anyone that likes stretching for relaxation or to soothe sore muscles.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Michelle LeMay's unique nurturning style relaxes and rejuvenates the body. Her warm Norah Jones/Rachael Ray type personality radiates on screen as her soft voice leads you through a series of stretches designed to release all your tension as you float away on clouds. Yes, clouds. There are clouds and a magic carpet. As the carpet floats in a calm sky of fluffy clouds, Michelle LeMay returns you to the world of peace.Her calm voice leads you through a series of beautiful healing stretches that feel like a movement meditation. She begins the routine with a simple set of standing stretches and then moves into a lunge series and postures you will recognize from yoga. A yoga mat may be useful while doing poses like triangle. Throughout the workout you start to feel your body relax into the rocking motions and deep stretches that melt away tension.Where other instructors teach you to stretch and then hold the stretch, Michelle LeMay rocks and nourishes the body. You move from side to side in some of the leg stretches and I enjoyed the spinal rolls, bird of paradise and careful pacing. Her cueing is more like guidance and her energy is subtle and healing.You may also want to look for her DVD: "Rejuvenating Core Stretch" Both have a similar feel and mood.~The Rebecca Review
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is a 48 min workout with a 2 min verbal intro & ends with a 10 min verbal guided meditation.This is set with just Michelle on a 5 X9 carpet on a sky blue blank stage that makes her look like she's floating in the sky. The music is basic synthesizer beat that is ok, but boring. Ocassionally when she says to "relax" or "let go" the words will be displayed in white like clouds. Best way I can describe the pace & look is it as a 1960s "peace" video. It's sweet, but a bit over the top.The stretches in the 48 min are good, head circles, core circles & flexes, horse stance, lunges (w/no hands, held for a long time), triangle, bridge, stand forward bends, butterly, sitting forward bends, wide-legged forward bends, wide legged seated side stretches, single leg stretches, crunch, laying twisted back stretches, etc. The same ones most dance or aerobic exercise dvds do as a warmup & same ones in most yoga dvds. There was only 2-3 stretches that I'd never seen before for opening up the hips, but since I'm flexible, I only moderately felt it.The pace is what bothered me the most, each stretch pose was done for a few seconds, then let go out, then back in, the let go, then back in for 1 to 2 real minutes & sometimes longer. It seemed very drawn out & boring. The stretches could have easily been done in 20-30 min & people can pause or rewind or redo it if they need more. Most people don't have a whole hour to watch a dvd just for stretching.There were no modifications for those who need this dvd the most, those with restrictions or chronic injuries. Though some of stretches seem a bit advanced & some require good balance & strength like the lunges, bridge & triangle poses.There was about a 10 min bonus stretch from her "7 essential stress relievers" that you would expect to be different, but was the same exact neck & core stretching done in the beginning of this dvd.
summary: Good stretches, but VERY slow pace & may bore you
Title: N/A
